Definition at line 216 of file platform_os.h.

#define COREDATA_DEPRECATED ( text_message   ) 

Marks mark classes and/or functions as no longer being supported.

Parameters:
text_message The message to be displayed by the compiler when code uses the deprecated function. It should indicate an alternative.
The macro should be placed before the return type for functions and between the class/struct keyword and identifier. 
    class COREDATA_DEPRECATED("Use class Radio instead.") Wireless
    {
    };
    COREDATA_DEPRECATED("Wrong naming, use turnOn().") void turn_on(Wireless&);

Definition at line 172 of file platform_os.h.

#define COREDATA_PRECONDITION ( cond,
message   ) 

Throws an exception if an expression evaluates to false.

Use this macro to check the documented preconditions for a function.

Parameters:
cond The expression that should evaluate to true.
message The message to use as the return value from std::exception::what().
Exceptions:
std::invalid_argument 

Definition at line 95 of file basics.h.

#define COREDATA_PURE_METHOD

Marks a virtual member function as being pure making the class abstract.

Use this macro over using = 0. 

    virtual void processData() COREDATA_PURE_METHOD;

Definition at line 125 of file basics.h.
